intro: Chaetanthera ciliaris, commonly known as the silky nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant features showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs. It typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. The fruits are small, berry-like structures that contain several seeds.
